intro: Clidemia althaeoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and along stream banks. Clidemia althaeoides is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some regions.
